topic_name: Young travels of self-discovery: Past and present
image_credits: A View of Paris from the Pont Neuf. By Nicolas-Jean-Baptiste Raguenet
topic_description: While the gap year has become very popular in recent years, it is not a new phenomenon. Throughout the 16th, 17th and 18th centuries, the young elite of England and France undertook travels to and from the European continent, broadening their cultural horizons. What did these ‘Grand Tours’ look like, and what can they tell us about the modern ‘gap year’? Emma Pauncefort has some answers.
